[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Field: G_2] [Point validation] Does the system verify that G_2 is not the identity element and lies on the twist curve, or can invalid points pass through causing pairing computation failures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new()] [Hash-to-curve side channel] Can the unsafe_hash_to_affine function leak information about the input ('G_2' string) through timing or power analysis, even though the input is constant? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: compute_powers_of_radix()] [Shift overflow] Does 1u64 << ell properly handle ell >= 64 by wrapping to 0, causing all powers to be 0 or 1 and completely breaking the chunking scheme? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: compute_powers_of_radix()] [Cast overflow] When converting num_chunks_per_scalar (u32) to usize for the utils::powers call, can this overflow on 16-bit platforms causing incorrect vector sizes? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new()] [Padded chunks overflow] Can the calculation ((max_num_shares * num_chunks_per_scalar + 1).next_power_of_two() - 1) underflow when the result is 0, causing a subtraction underflow panic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new()] [Table size cast] When building the table with 1u32 << (ell/2), does casting ell (u8) to compute ell/2 properly handle odd values, or can this create off-by-one errors in table size? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: Deserialize::deserialize()] [ell/2 division] For odd ell values, does ell/2 truncate causing the table to be built with insufficient size, leading to missing entries in discrete log lookups? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Field: table] [Memory leak] If PublicParameters is cloned or deserialized repeatedly, can the large table HashMap cause memory exhaustion as old tables aren't properly freed? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Field: powers_of_radix] [Vector allocation attack] Can an attacker trigger allocation of extremely large powers_of_radix vectors (if num_chunks_per_scalar returns huge values) causing OOM panics? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Derive: Clone] [Deep clone overhead] Does cloning PublicParameters with large tables and vectors cause performance issues or temporary memory spikes that could be exploited for DoS? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Struct: PublicParameters] [Drop implementation] Is there a custom Drop implementation to securely zero sensitive cryptographic material, or do secrets persist in memory after parameters are freed? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Serialization] [BCS version compatibility] If the BCS format changes in future versions, can deserialization of old PublicParameters cause undefined behavior or security vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Serialization] [ark_se/ark_de security] Do the arkworks serialization helpers properly validate group elements during deserialization, or can malformed arkworks data inject invalid curve points? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Serialization] [Compression vulnerability] If arkworks uses point compression, can decompression errors or ambiguities be exploited to inject points with different properties than intended? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Serialization] [Field order dependency] Does the serialization order of fields matter for security, or can reordering during deserialization cause parameters to be initialized incorrectly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Serialization] [Partial deserialization] If deserialization fails midway (e.g., after deserializing pp_elgamal but before pk_range_proof), can partial PublicParameters objects be leaked or exploited? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Struct: PublicParameters] [Concurrent modification] If multiple threads access PublicParameters simultaneously, can the interior HashMap be modified causing data races, even though the struct doesn't use Cell/RefCell? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: get_commitment_base()] [Race condition] Can concurrent calls to get_commitment_base() create race conditions if the internal G_2 field is lazily initialized or cached? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new()] [RNG thread safety] If the RNG passed to new() is shared across threads without proper locking, can this create race conditions that compromise cryptographic randomness? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Field: table] [Read-only safety] Even though the table HashMap is only read after initialization, can Rust's memory model allow stale reads if parameters are passed across threads without proper synchronization? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Generic: E: Pairing] [Insufficient bounds] Are the Pairing trait bounds sufficient, or should additional bounds like HashToField or Serialization be enforced to prevent misuse? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Trait: traits::HasEncryptionPublicParams] [Type confusion] Can the EncryptionPublicParameters associated type be instantiated with a different curve than the PublicParameters, causing type confusion attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Trait: Convert] [Source type manipulation] Can an attacker provide an InputSecret with properties that exploit the conversion to DealtPubKey, such as zero secrets or secrets exceeding the field modulus? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Struct: PublicParameters] [Phantom data missing] Should PublicParameters use PhantomData to enforce lifetime or invariant properties, or can the current design allow dangling references? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Struct: PublicParameters] [Parameter substitution] Can a malicious validator distribute different PublicParameters to different nodes, causing the DKG ceremony to fail or produce inconsistent keys? (Critical)
